correlation.missingLQMsg: This correlation query is referencing an undefined link qualifier.  You should remove this correlation query or create the link qualifier.
correlation.notAvailableMsg2: associated with this property is not available.  Add this link qualifier or update the condition.
correlation.conditionScriptInfo: Define how to conditionally update a property, using either a link qualifier or a script.

correlation.linkQualifierStaticInfo: Static lists will apply each qualifier to every source record.
correlation.linkQualifierScriptInfo: Dynamic scripts may return different qualifiers for each source record.

audit.eventTypesDesc: The eventTypes configuration specifies what events OpenIDM writes to audit logs. OpenIDM supports the following event types: access, activity, synchronization, and reconciliation. The filter for actions under activity logging shows the actions on managed or system objects for which OpenIDM writes to the activity log.
audit.noMoreEvents: There are no more events to add.

dialog.filterActionsDesc: The filter actions list enables you to configure the conditions that result in actions being written to the activity log.
dialog.noActions: There are no actions for this type of event.
dialog.filterScriptDesc: You can create a script for filtering. As it does for other scripts, OpenIDM makes the create request and the context objects available to the script.
dialog.watchedFieldsDesc: The Watched Fields parameter enables you to specify a list of fields that should be monitored for changes.
dialog.passwordFieldsDesc: The passwordFields parameter enables you to specify a list of fields that are considered passwords.

audit.logToDesc: The logTo parameter enables you to specify the format, location of where the file will be written, and various properties for each log type specified.
audit.exceptionFormatterDesc: Specify how exceptions are to be formatted and display by the audit logger.

auth.sessionInfo: The Session Module sets token life and idle time limits on user sessions.
auth.authInfo: Configure desired Authentication Modules to verify identities. OpenIDM evaluates these modules in the order specified.
auth.errorsmsg: Please address the errors in the Authentication modules before saving.
auth.openamDeploymentUrlConfirmation: OpenAM Deployment URL is invalid. Would you like to continue?

connector.whatIsAConnector: Connectors provide interfaces to external systems, databases, directory services, and more.

connector.pendingObjectTypes: Click Save Object Types to save your pending object type changes.
connector.pendingConnectorChanges: Click Save Connector changes to save your pending connector changes.

ldapConnector.syncMessage: Use these same base contexts for LiveSync?
ldapConnector.baseContextToSyncNote: During LiveSync operations, OpenIDM searches these base contexts for changes.
ldapConnector.certificateHint: Paste your server's Base64-encoded X509 certificate here, if self-signed or signed by an unknown Certificate Authority
ldapConnector.baseContextNote: Be sure to add base contexts which include both your users and your groups.

google.listHeader: You must grant this project access to all of the following APIs:
google.callbackUrlMessage: Be sure your project is configured to use this callback URL
google.needHelp: Need help locating your client ID and secret?
google.changeHeader: Note for new and recently-changed projects
google.changeDetails: When you create a new project in Google, it can take up to 24 hours for the data to be propagated through Google. If you are setting up OpenIDM with a project that you have just created, or if you have recently changed the Callback URL of your project, you might receive an error when you attempt to validate the client ID and secret.

salesforce.callbackUrlMessage: Your application must be configured to use this Callback URL
salesforce.listHeader: You must grant this application all of the following OAuth Scopes:
salesforce.listItemThree: Perform requests on your behalf at any time
salesforce.changeHeader: Note for new and recently-changed applications
salesforce.changeDetails: When you create a new Connected App, or update your Connected App in Salesforce, it takes some time (at least five minutes) for the data to be propagated through all the Salesforce servers. If you are setting up OpenIDM with a Connected App that you have just created, or if you have recently changed the Callback URL of your Connected App, you might receive an error when you attempt to validate the consumer key and consumer secret. You should therefore wait at least five minutes after creating or updating your Connected App before you attempt to set up OpenIDM with that App.
salesforce.needHelpKey: Need help locating your consumer key and secret?

mapping.validLinkQualifierScript: Requires a valid Link Qualifier script.
mapping.linkQualifierNotArray: Valid Link Qualifier must be an array.
mapping.badScript: Invalid; a Link Qualifier script must return an array of strings
mapping.uniqueLinkQualifiers: The link qualifier must be unique.
mapping.createMappingMessage: Click this button to create a mapping between these two sources.
mapping.saveMappingMessage: Please enter a unique mapping name.
mapping.confirmDeleteMapping:
Are you sure you want to delete the "__mappingName__" mapping?

**Caution: this action cannot be reversed.
mapping.confirmRemoveProperty: Are you sure you want to remove the "__property__" property mapping?
mapping.transformRequiredForMulti: A transformation script is required when mapping from a multiple-value source to a single-value target.
mapping.validPropertyRequired: You must select a valid property name.
mapping.invalidScript: You cannot save a transformation script that contains errors.
mapping.invalidConditionScript: You cannot save a condition script that contains errors.
mapping.mappingExists: Mapping for this target property already exists.
mapping.roleEntitlementsDescription: View role entitlements assigned to this mapping.

propertyEdit.title: Target Property: __property__
propertyEdit.valuePrecedenceNote: Since the values mapped might result in multiple values, sort them here to establish which should take precedence (the first value matched will be used).
propertyEdit.propertyListLabel: Enter or select the source property that you need
propertyEdit.transformationSciptLabel: Enter a transformation script for complex properties.
propertyEdit.conditionSciptLabel: Enter a conditional update script for
propertyEdit.defaultValuesLabel: Set a default value for this property mapping.
propertyEdit.transformScriptNote:
Use JavaScript code above to perform advanced mapping operations.
This script will be processed for each source object that is mapped, to calculate its value for this property.
The result of the final statement in the script will be used as the value for this property.
This script has the "source" variable available to it as input.
The value for the "source" variable depends on how you have defined the attribute mapping in the "Attribute List" tab.
If you haven't selected any value in the "Property List" tab, then "source" will be the complete source object with properties for each directory property.
If you have selected a value in "Property List", then "source" will be that value.
propertyEdit.conditionScriptNote:
Use JavaScript code above to prevent target data from being updated in certain conditions.
This script will be processed for each source object that is mapped.
If the result is true or if there is no script the property will be updated, otherwise updates will not be sent to the target.
This script has the "object" variable available to it as a global.
The "object" variable represents the complete source record with properties for each source property mapping.

analysis.clickToAnalyze: to start analyzing relationships between Source and Target data.
analysis.newLinkCreated: New link created. No changes until after the next reconciliation.
analysis.newLinksWarning: __count__ records have changed since last Reconciliation.
analysis.oneNewLinkWarning: 1 record has changed since last Reconciliation
analysis.forResultsToTakeEffect: for the result of these changes to take effect.

reconAnalysis.ambiguousMessage: The source object qualifies for a target object, there is no link to an existing target object, but there is more than one correlated target object (that is, more than one possible match on the target system). This situation is detected during source object changes and reconciliation.
reconAnalysis.sourceMissingMessage: The target object qualifies and a link is found, but the source object is missing. This situation is detected during change events and reconciliation.
reconAnalysis.missingMessage: The source object qualifies for a target object, and there is a link to a target object, but the target object is missing. This situation is detected during reconciliation operations and during source object changes.
reconAnalysis.foundAlreadyLinkedMessage: The source object qualifies for a target object and there is no link from that source object to an existing target object. There is a single target object, that correlates with this source object, according to the logic in the correlation query, but that target object is already linked to a different source object. This situation is detected during change events and reconciliation.
reconAnalysis.unqualifiedMessage: The source object is unqualified (by the "validSource" script). One or more target objects are found through the correlation logic. This situation is detected during change events and reconciliation.'
reconAnalysis.unassignedMessage: A valid target object exists, for which there is no link. This situation is detected only during reconciliation operations.
reconAnalysis.targetIgnoredMessage: During target reconciliation, the target becomes unqualified by the "validTarget" script. This situation is detected only during reconciliation operations.
reconAnalysis.sourceIgnoredMessage: The source object is unqualified (by the "validSource" script), no link is found, and no correlated target exists. This situation is detected during source object changes and reconciliation.
reconAnalysis.allGoneMessage: The source object has been removed. No link is found. Correlation is not possible, for one of the following reasons. No previous source value can be found, there is no correlation query, or a previous value was found, and a correlation query exists, but has no corresponding target was found. This situation is detected only during source object changes.
reconAnalysis.linkOnlyMessage: The source may or may not be qualified, a link is found, but no target object is found. This situation is detected only during source object changes.
reconAnalysis.confirmedMessage: The source object qualifies for a target object, and a link to an existing target object was found. This situation is detected during change events and during reconciliation.
reconAnalysis.foundMessage: The source object qualifies for a target object and there is no link to an existing target object. There is a single target object, that correlates with this source object, according to the logic in the correlation query. This situation is detected during change events and reconciliation.
reconAnalysis.absentMessage: The source object qualifies for a target object, there is no link to an existing target object, and there is no correlated target object found. This situation is detected during change events and reconciliation.
